Dialogue: Come on. She's been under too long.
You're the only one who can help me.
Tell me what I need to know.
The name, pal. Give us the name.
- Did we get it? - We got it.
Would you like to watch a movie, Mr Rosen?
Would you like to watch a movie, Mr Phelps?
Would you consider the cinema of the Ukraine?
Perhaps you'll choose one for me.
The man you're looking at is Alexander Golitsyn,
an attache at our embassy in Prague.
He has stolen half of a CIA NOC list -
a record of all our deep-cover agents in Eastern Europe.
For security reasons, the NOC list is divided in two.
The portion that Golitsyn already has contains code names,
but it is useless without its mate,
which matches the code names with their true names.
It is this half which Golitsyn plans to steal from the embassy
Your mission, Jim, should you choose to accept it,
is to obtain photographic proof of the theft,
shadow Golitsyn to his buyer and apprehend them both.
We've already dispatched a team selected from your usual group.
Jack Harmon can hack into any security system,
and Ethan Hunt will be your point man as usual.
He will rendezvous in Prague at a safe house of your choosing.
As always, should any member of IM Force be caught or killed
the secretary will disavow all knowledge of your actions.
This tape will self-destruct in five seconds. Good luck, Jim.
we photograph Golitsyn stealing the NOC list,
Ethan, you're going into the embassy in character during a party.
Hide in plain sight - highest possible profile.
- Are you game? - Wouldn't have it any other way.
Sarah, you're at the party already
as the embassy's Washington visitor liaison.
Make contact with Ethan. You'll run the game together.
You'll mark Golitsyn, hand him to Hannah.
Hannah, you'll have him for the duration of the interior.
There's access through the elevator shaft here.
- So I'm not wearing my tux? - Open, close, get out.
Claire, you'll cover outside in the vehicle.
Hannah will join you as Golitsyn goes exterior.
- Stay on him from there. - OK.
Anything goes wrong, I call abort - everybody walk away, immediately.
Yeah. Can we get a cappuccino machine? What do you call this?
- I call it cruel and unusual. - I made that coffee.
Exactly. It's even worse than the sludge you made in Kiev.
Take it easy on my wife's coffee.
- We missed you in Kiev, Jim. - You, too, Ethan.
- On one of your cushy assignments? - Where this time? The Plaza?
- He's getting soft. - Yeah, look at him.
OK, listen. If that list gets out into the open,
the names of our agents in Eastern Europe go to the highest bidders -
Third World terrorists, arms dealers, drug lords,
anybody who'd love to get rid of long-term coverts like us.
If they're exposed, they'll be executed.
So, I'll run the show from here. Everyone knows their roles.
There's a camera built right into the bridge.
Whatever you see, it sees and transmits back here.
- See? Can you hear me? - Of course I can hear you.
No, in your... oh, you need an earpiece.
You have lovely eyes. Can you hear me now?
If he has a car waiting and rolls, stay with him no matter what.
You should take the afternoon, drive the streets around this quarter.
- They're confusing. - What do you think I've been doing?
Isn't he chairing the armed services hearing?
This week, he's fishing at the Oughterard Slough in County Kildare
with one of our best Irish guides.
Yup. And he won't be back any time soon.
..Irrelevant at best, or unconstitutional at worst.
With respect, Senator, it sounds as if you want the kind of charge
that Senator Frank Church led in the 1970s
and to destroy the intelligence capability of this country.
I want to know who these people are
We were living in a democracy the last time I checked.
You come up against a lock you can't pick,
Hasta lasagne, don't get any on ya.
Senator. I'm Rand Housman, the Ambassador's aide.
- Hello, Mr Housman. - How was the opera?
Let me steer you through this reception line.
- How do you do, Senator? - Mrs Reed.
Petr Brandl, the Mayor of Prague, and Mrs Brandl.
Oh! I bet you don't remember me, do you?
Of course. How are you, Miss Norman?
He's in pocket, on the stairway.
Mr Golitsyn, nice to see you.
Sarah, mark the package and go to two.
Your advance team mentioned you'd like a tour.
I've set one up. Excuse me. This way.
the only limited-access area in the whole facility.
- Can I help you? - Oh, I'm sorry.
As you can see, there's a Marine guard and video surveillance...
This place is like... excuse me. I'm sorry. It's here somewhere.
Sergeant, why are you not in uniform this evening?
Uh, we've been ordered to wear civilian clothes this evening, sir.
Senator, is anyone on your staff named Jack?
Jack? Uh, we did have a Jack.
An unreliable fellow, as I recall -
constantly late and behind in his work.
We were forced to tie him behind a stallion
and drag him around for a few days.
Relax your crack. I'm working on it.
Sorry, sir. Thank you. Have a nice evening.
That date with Sarah is definitely off.
He's heading to the denied area.
Get moving, Ethan. He's rolling to you.
- Where's my coat? - Jack, open the doors.
- OK. Open these doors. - I don't have it.
I'm opening the doors. Go under.
Jack, we're in position. Open the doors and let the package roll.
- Jack, what are you doing? - Nothing!
- Then I got a problem. - Cut the power.
- Cut the power. - Come on, Jack.
The package is in the open.
- He's in the open. - En route.
Jim, the package is in the open.
- I've got a shadow. - Can you lose him?
We're being ambushed, Ethan. Abort. That's an order.
Negative. Golitsyn is on the move.
No, damn it! No! I said abort!
Sarah, eye on the package. Jim, I'm coming.
Jim gave an abort. Walk away.
We are going to recover that disk. You understand me?
My team. My team is dead!
They knew we were coming, man. They knew and the disk is gone.
- Are you intact? - It's gone. Do you read me?
- The list is in the open! - I read you.
Let's bring you in safely, then we'll worry about that, OK?
Don't think. Be sure. Are you clean?
OK. Location green, one hour. I'll be there myself.
I can't tell you how, er... sorry I am.
I know how much Jim in particular meant to you, Ethan,
Here's a passport, visa. Usual drill.
We'll work exfiltration through Canada, debrief you at Langley.
Throw the Prague police a bone or two. Toss them a few suspects.
I think we've lost enough agents for one night.
You mean, I'VE lost enough agents for one night.
You seem hell-bent on blaming yourself, Ethan.
Of IMF agents at the embassy, tonight.
Well, see if you can follow me around the room.
The drunk Russians on the embankment at 7, 8 o'clock.
The couple waltzing around me at the embassy at 9 and 11.
The waiter standing behind Hannah at the stairs -
Well, for a little over two years,
we've been spotting serious blowback in IMF operations.
The other day, we decoded a message on the Internet
from a Czech we know as "Max".
Max, it seems, has two unique gifts...
This time, he'd gotten to someone on the inside.
He'd gotten in a position to buy our NOC list.
An operation he referred to as Job 314,
the job he thought Golitsyn was doing tonight.
But the list Golitsyn stole was a decoy.
That's correct. The actual list is secure at Langley.
Golitsyn was a lightning rod. One of ours.
This whole operation was a mole hunt.
This whole operation was a mole hunt.
I want to show you something, Ethan.
your family's farm has been in receivership,
and now, suddenly, they're flush with over 120 grand in the bank.
Your father's illness was supposed to have wiped out that bank account.
Dying slowly in America, after all, can be an expensive proposition.
why don't we quietly get out of here and onto a plane?
Kittridge, you've never seen me upset.
All right, Hunt. Enough is enough.
You have bribed, cajoled, and killed,
and you've done it from the inside.
You want to court the devil, fine. Do it in hell.
Money, money. Where's the damn money?
The other day, we decoded a message on the Internet
He'd got in a position to buy our NOC list.
An operation he referred to as Job 314.
Oh, you son of a bitch.
I needed you, Ethan. I needed you... on the bridge...
Just calm down. It's Claire. It's OK.
Shut up! I saw you. You were in the car.
No, I got out of the car.
I ran to the bridge. He said someone was...
Don't give me that. I was there. There was nobody on the bridge.
- What happened to Jim? - Wake up! Jim's dead!
- Who sent you for me? - Jim's dead...
I walked away. He said abort. I just... walked away.
That was four hours ago. Who sent you?
- Look, who sent you? - No one sent me.
We were supposed to be back here at four o'clock.
If we abort, we don't return here until 4.00, 0400, 4 a.m...
They actually think I killed Jim and everyone else.
Somehow $100,000 finds its way into my parents' bank account.
Kittridge assumes I'm the mole they've been tracing
and I've been in the employ of an arms dealer, Max,
for the last two years... to get him our NOC list.
- What are you going to do? - I'm going to get it for him.
Ethan, you're not making any sense.
Whoever the mole is goes by the name of Job.
I can't find him, but if he knows I have the NOC list,
I'm going in and telling Kittridge you had nothing to do with this.
Claire, if you're not dead, he's going to assume you're with me.
and I'm going to answer it.
Excuse me. Can I trouble you for a match?
Could you remove your hat, please?
I thought I was going to see Max.
You misunderstood. No one sees Max.
Then what the hell am I doing here?
Allowing Max to see you and hear what you've got to say.
I don't communicate very well through a shroud.
If Max doesn't like what you have to say,
you'll be wearing that shroud indefinitely.
I'm willing to take the chance.
Who are you and what are you doing here?
You thought if you simply showed up, I might give it to you?
Hmm... the penny drops. You are not Job.
Job is not given to quoting scripture in his communications.
So you are something of a paradox.
That's quite out of the question.
It's bait... part of an internal mole hunt.
And how might you know that?
That is the question I want to ask Job.
I don't know Job any more than Job knows me.
I'm sure you could arrange an introduction.
I can deliver the actual NOC list.
The one you have is worthless
and certain to have a homing device to pinpoint your location.
you'll have Virginia farm boys hopping around you like rabbits.
It's easy to say the disk is worthless
when you say I can't look and see if it's worthless.
Not so good for you, my friend.
I'd say you've got about two minutes.
Doesn't mean a signal. Could just be heating up.
He's under until he decides to surface.
We'll involve the local authorities. Cut off his transportation.
Put a guy at the airport? How many identities do you think Hunt has?
How many times has he slipped past customs in how many countries?
These guys are trained to be ghosts.
- We taught them, for Christ's sake. - What do you suggest?
Let's not waste time chasing him. Let's make him come to us.
You find something that's personally important to him and you squeeze.
Gunther will never let me have one of his apartments again.
Sorry I doubted you, dear boy.
Ha ha. I don't have to tell you
what a comfort anonymity can be in my profession.
My deal with Job was subject to a successful boot scan.
Obviously it didn't pass muster. Deal's off.
What was your deal with Job?
but I want the complete list now, not just Eastern Europe.
I won't do this piecemeal. It's too dangerous. The entire list.
10 million in negotiable US Treasury certificates
in bearer form, coupons attached, and one more thing.
Your personal assurance that Job will be at the exchange.
Max made a deal with you?
I deliver the NOC list, Max delivers Job.
We've got 75 rounds for your Beretta,
but only 20 for the Sig Sauer.
One pair of Visco glasses with monitor.
You said it yourself, if I'm not dead, I'm with you.
I want to get the son of a bitch who did this.
We're going to need some help. We don't have a lot of time,
so they'll have to be local.
If we're going to Virginia, why don't we drop by Fort Knox?
I can fly a helicopter through the lobby and land inside the vault.
And it would be easier than breaking into the goddamn CIA.
I don't know. I just don't know.
Well, this doesn't sound like the Luther Stickell I heard of.
What did they call you, the Net Ranger?
The only man alive who actually hacked Nato Ghostcom.
There was never any physical evidence
that I had anything to do with that... with that...
You don't know what you're missing.
This is the Mount Everest of hacks.
Even with top of the line crypto, Cray access, STU 3s...
That's not what Claire tells me about you.
with the artificial intelligence risk chip.
And, uh... I get to keep the equipment when we're done.
Luther, I guess you're all out of excuses.
Look, uh... I just can't hack my way inside.
See, there's no modem access to the mainframe.
It's in what we call the stand alone,
which means I'll have to be physically at the terminal.
It's much worse than you think.
The terminal is in a black vault lockdown.
The only person allowed in the room
has to pass through a series of security checks.
The first is a voiceprint identification
This only gets him into the outer room.
Next, he has to pass a retinal scan.
are only deactivated by a double electronic key card...
Now, inside the black vault, there are three systems operating
whenever the technician is out of the room.
anything above a whisper sets it off.
The second system detects any increase in temperature.
Even the body heat of an unauthorised person in the room
will trigger it if the temperature rises just a single degree.
That temperature is controlled by the air conditioning
coming in through an overhead duct 30 feet above the floor.
That vent is guarded by a laser net.
The third system is on the floor and is pressure sensitive.
The slightest increase in weight will trigger the alarm,
and any one of these systems,
if set off, will activate an automatic lockdown.
Now... believe me when I tell you, gentlemen, all three systems
And you really think we can do this?
We picked up alarms in Sectors 3, 7, and 12.
- I got to shut it down. - Sorry, nobody gets in there.
No one goes into any sector where the alarm hasn't gone off,
Too short-sighted. This guy initiates. He's proactive.
The question is, what does he want? Where does he need to get it?
Hey, there were three of you. Where's the other guy?
Krieger, from here on in, absolute silence.
You and I know about this.
That's where it stops, you understand?
- It never happened. - What about him?
I want him manning a radar tower in Alaska. Mail him his clothes.
You're not going to any meeting without me.
I don't think you're in any position to give orders, do you?
What's the matter? You've never seen this trick?
I know what you're thinking, Krieger.
You're thinking, back in the computer room,
I was up here, he was... he was down there.
So hard to keep track of these things.
Do you actually think I'd let you have the NOC list?
Try any sleight of hand with my money, and I'll cut your throat.
You're off on one of your cushy recruiting assignments again?
Yeah. Where'd they put you up this time, the Plaza?
We did what we had to do.
I'm going to try and get some sleep.
Krieger did have the NOC list?
- You hold on to it. - What makes you trust me?
Because if you knew about it, you never would have done it.
I'm not going to let this get out in the open.
Exactly. That's your job tomorrow on the train.
Don't let this NOC list get out in the open.
What is the range of this thing?
It's hard to tell. We're going to have to be close.
Ethan, I need to talk to you.
a farm in the heartland of America, the state of Wisconsin,
where Federal Agents claim to have found the brains
The operation was masterminded by Margaret Ethan Hunt
by drug enforcement officers in a major sting operation
of the drug Methcathinone, known as Cat.
I see you've been out visiting the folks.
It's Hunt. What do you need for a pinpoint?
You've been watching a little TV, have you?
Hauling mom off to jail in shackles was an especially nice touch.
Ethan, I want to assure you
that my first order of business after you come in
is to have these ridiculous charges against your family dropped
and eliminated completely from their files.
If you, uh, if you come in now,
we can plea down the charges against you as well.
Can I ask you something, Kittridge?
If you're dealing with someone who's crushed, stabbed,
five members of his own IMF team...
how devastated do you think he'll be
by marching Ma and Uncle Donald to the county courthouse?
I don't know, Ethan. Why don't you tell me?
He wanted us to know he was in London.
You're a hard man to catch up with.
The next day I managed to drag myself to the safe house.
I must have just missed you. Anyway, I checked our aliases.
Then you followed us to the States.
But you left before I could get there.
Smaller countries don't computerise customs records.
Once you turned up in England, it was easy.
You knew I liked the rentals at Liverpool Street.
Hey, I showed them to you.
Who do you think you're kidding here?
A doctor's got to see you. You can't sit up straight.
I can sit up straight. I just can't sit up straight very well.
Sit down. Sit down. It's not important.
My God, of course. You're right.
He was at the embassy that night.
First, he took out Jack at the elevator.
He shot you on the bridge.
He must have had back-up to take out Golitsyn and Sarah at the fence.
No. No. He could have done Hannah himself.
When you think about it, Ethan, it was inevitable. No more cold war.
No more secrets you keep from everyone but yourself.
Operations - you answer to no one but yourself.
And then one day you wake up.
The President is running the country without your permission.
The son of a bitch. How dare he?
You're an obsolete piece of hardware not worth upgrading.
You've got a lousy marriage and 62 grand a year.
We'll go after the no-good son of a bitch big time.
What's going to make him do that?
What he didn't get in Prague - the NOC list.
I'm meeting tomorrow on the TGV, en route to Paris.
If I supposedly deliver the NOC list to Max,
Max has agreed to deliver Job to me.
I'll have Claire and Luther Stickell with me on the train.
Krieger will have helicopter transport waiting in Paris.
I was in a cafe waiting for you, Ethan.
God knows what she's had to do to forget me, to keep going,
She can't know about me, Ethan. No one can until this is over.
Once we leave the safe house, Jim, you get in there and crash.
I sent the message to Max.
X-ray's clean, electronics, and no explosives.
How long to the London Terminus?
This was not what we discussed.
My apologies, Max. It couldn't be helped.
There's a piece of black cloth under your seat.
Tear it away, and you'll find the disk.
I hope this doesn't preclude a meeting in private.
Not as long as you tell me where the money is.
The mere possibility is worth 10 million.
When you get the money, he'll find you.
Damn it, I've got to get this through before we hit the Channel.
I can see that. Did you check the batteries?
Don't give me that. Run it through from the top.
This is bullshit. We don't even know what Max looks like.
If he's got that list, he's going to check it. And that means laptops.
Ethan, Kittridge is on the train.
The money's in the baggage car. I'll meet you there.
Is it such a good idea to kill him?
No one else has seen you alive.
I'm very sorry to hear you say that, Claire.
Ethan Hunt, darling. You remember him, don't you?
Just exactly when he knew is something of a question.
Before or after I showed up in London?
But after you took the Bible from the Drake Hotel in Chicago.
They stamped it, didn't they? Those damn Gideons.
Ethan... if you knew about Jim, why...
But he didn't know about you.
Claire was never convinced her charms would work on you.
"Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's wife", Ethan.
Let's get the money and get out.
You know, Claire was wrong about one thing, Jim.
I'm not the only one who's seen you alive.
No, no, don't! It'll crash into us!
I think this is what you're looking for.
My lawyers are going to have a field day with this.
Well, maybe we'll just leave the courts out of this one.
I'm sure we can find something I have that you need.
In a freak accident, a helicopter lost altitude, veered into a tunnel,
and collided with a train on its way from London to Paris.
The pilot was killed, but no one on the train was hurt.
Authorities have attributed the accident to instrument failure...
Reach your folks? How do they feel?
The apology from the Justice Department,
VIP treatment, you know, the whole 9 yards.
Well, my mom was a little confused
how the DEA could mistake her and Uncle Donald
for a couple of dope smugglers in the Florida Keys.
For being off the disavowed list.
Hey, I'm the flavour of the month.
Why don't you come back with me?
I just... l just don't know why I'd be doing it.
Got to go catch my flight.
So how does it feel to be a solid citizen again?
I'm going to miss being disreputable.
Well, Luther, if it makes you feel any better,
I'll always think of you that way.
Would you like to watch a movie?
Would you consider the cinema of the Caribbean?
